item.title: Dual Core, Quad Core, Up to 64 Core Managed Dedicated Servers
item.description: The race for faster processors has shifted its focus. Instead of increasing clock speeds, the industry is now prioritizing multi-core and multi-processor designs to improve performance. The good news is that there are affordable options for powerful processing, including managed dedicated servers with excellent support. Entry-level systems typically feature dual-core processors. For increased power, users can opt for quad-core or hexa-core (6 cores) configurations. For even greater performance, dual or quad-processor dedicated servers are available.

item.title: How Your Port Sets Your Bandwidth
item.description: By: John Shepler As MAN and WAN telecom service users, we understand the limitations of our contracted bandwidth. What was once sufficient can become restrictive, impacting application performance and productivity. What can be done to increase bandwidth and eliminate this congestion? Connection Speed Limits While you can utilize less than the maximum capacity of a line, exceeding it is not possible. The maximum speed is determined by factors such as the type of transmission medium (e.
